items.content_html:
Bumps @mdn/yari from 2.63.0 to 2.63.1.

Release notes

Sourced from @​mdn/yari's releases.

v2.63.1

2.63.1 (2024-09-16)

Bug Fixes

  • build: use pipefail to fail function deployments (#11806) (5141019)
  • placement: use variable for horizontal banner (#11795) (d880aaf)
  • sidebar: reuse icon margin for non-nested entries (#11786) (2294df0)

Enhancements

  • ad-free: hide all banners completely (#11787) (f93b850)

Miscellaneous

  • deps-dev: bump @​playwright/test from 1.47.0 to 1.47.1 (#11812) (8e698db)

Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @mdn-bot.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot show <dependency name> ignore conditions will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump @mdn/yari from 2.63.0 to 2.63.1

items.content_html:
This adds to the release note in FF131. The point here is that FF has a default of Same-Site=None so if Same-Site is not set the restriction previously added to the release not applies. This is IMO significant because it will stop cookies that haven't specified their samesite cookie behaviour explicitly from working (unless they add Secure).

Note comes from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1909673#c8

Related docs work in #35697
items.title: F131Relnote Set-Cookie with no samesite also requires Secure

items.content_html:
Description

Add a link to the Go implementation I wrote of the URL Pattern standard.

Motivation

I hope it can be useful for Go developers.
items.title: URLPattern: add link to Go implementation

add PictureInPictureEvent to API interface list, and fixes in permissions-policy (seems to be conflict with fullscreen?)

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

relates to mdn/translated-content#23557
items.title: Update groupdata of Picture-In-Picture API & some other update

items.content_html:
• fix #35819

When the background has no color or image, it is transparent, so the border has no effect. The statement comes from the Wiki era, so there is no point in dissecting it.

The PR adds new statements on the same lines.
items.title: fix(css): background-clip update border-box prose

items.content_html:
https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds-4/#valdef-background-clip-border-area

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add `background-clip: border-area`

items.content_html:
Description

Mention implicit anchoring, and update the RegExp flag.

Makes this description consistent with the dedicated pattern attribute documentation.

Motivation

The current documentation is overly simplistic, hence confusing. I read the HTML5 spec to discover there is implicit anchoring. Let's save future readers time. ✨
items.title: Update `pattern` attribute

items.content_html:
Description

I saw this issue #35835 and thought about adding a small description to add more context to the purpose of the property.

Motivation

I've contributed in the past and want to continue when I can!

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

It fixes #35835
Relates to #35835
items.title: chore: add missing info on the purpose of scrollbar-width property

Description

The example used to return Accept-Ranges: none, but this is no longer the case.
Removing the example completely and doing some tidy while I'm at it.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #16073
items.title: chore(http): Remove range request example no longer returning 'accept-ranges: none'

items.content_html:
Description

move the days determination logic to the createCalendar function, as described in mdn/learning-area#469.

Related issues and pull requests

Part of: mdn/learning-area#469

Should be merged with mdn/learning-area#766
items.title: refactor: move the days determination logic to the createCalendar function

items.content_html:
Description

ETags are transformed by Apache Server when compression is applied via mod_deflate.
This has implications for conditional requests.

Motivation

Readers should be aware of cases where ETags are modified by reverse proxies.

Additional details

  • https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=39727
  • apache/httpd@c787a3e (Fixup ETag handling in mod deflate)
  • https://github.com/apache/httpd/blob/4915c21524e7ed2cf0dcfcf93d8be9139337497d/modules/filters/mod_deflate.c#L495-L500 (No longer "only weak" validation)

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #4343
items.title: feat(http): Describe how reverse proxies transform ETags when content encoding changes

items.content_html:
Description

This work is part of improving the web/manifest docs.

Notable changes in this PR:

  • name and short_name:

    • Added "Description" (info from spec plus some general guidelines) and "See also" sections
    • Removed reference to dir and lang because they are not implemented (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Manifest)
    • Updated examples and added prose

  • start_url:

    • "Description" and "Privacy considerations" sections cover info from the spec
    • Added more explanation in examples

Motivation

To ensure all sections have sufficient explanation, all caveats from spec are covered, and the pages follow a similar template

Additional details

  • Spec links:
    • https://w3c.github.io/manifest/#name-member
    • https://w3c.github.io/manifest/#short_name-member
    • https://w3c.github.io/manifest/#start_url-member

Related issues and pull requests

Tracking issue: mdn/mdn#560
items.title: docs(manifest): Improvements to `name`, `short_name`, `start_url`

items.content_html:
Description

This fixes #35825 by ensuring that yarn start works. Currently this breaks on both Node 20 and 22 due to scripts using a mix of syntax only supported by either version.

Motivation

I wanted to contribute a tiny fix and this made it impossible to check the result by firing up yarn start (it still does, by the way, as the proxy feature doesn't seem to work on my Mac). Now, at least, I can run tests and linting.

Additional details

  • Remove deprecated 'assert' import syntax in favor of 'with'
  • Specify engines field to minimum Node 22 for experimental 'import ...with' support

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #35825

Background
nodejs/node#51622

Note that with is already unflagged in 20 and 21 (and in 18 right now it just doesn't exist, not even behind a flag).
items.title: Fix failing `yarn start` and missing supported Node versions

items.content_html:
Some people are still using the old color syntax, old rgba(), and old hsla() functions. The PR adds lint rule to report the cases.

Note: There was a suggestion to use Stylelint to do this. I don't think the stylelint works on markdown files. Also, like ESLint, Stylelint is a linter, so we may face the same issues using it on the CSS code spread over multiple code fences. Got no response from the concerned person when asked on Discord. So sending this PR that uses regex and markdownlinter.

  • ⚠️ Merge this after #35613
items.title: fix(markdownlint): report 'rgba()', 'hsla()', and old color syntax

items.content_html:
Description

Changed line number referenced in docs to the correct line.

Motivation

Avoid confusion.

Additional details

HTML file being referenced in docs:

https://github.com/mdn/learning-area/blob/ba2ef1dcbf027cd4778ea258f484045b89905e2b/javascript/introduction-to-js-1/troubleshooting/number-game-errors.html

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: fix: incorrect line reference in docs

items.content_html:
Description

This PR removes the "Basics of HTTP" document in favor of using the https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP landing page to list everything.

Motivation

There are guides that are less visible nested further down the tree, this surfaces those resources, and reorganizes the index for maintainability.

⚠️dependencies:⚠️

Requires Yari sidebars change for HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/* -> HTTP/*, plus HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP removal.

  • mdn/yari#11753

Fixes #6955
Fixes #4922
items.title: chore(http): delete "Basics of HTTP" page in favor of HTTP landing page, reorganize index

items.content_html:
This is a "refresh" of the Permissions API docs. I'm doing it as part of looking at addition of microphone and camera permissions. The docs are a bit dated - they won't be perfect after this, but they will be better.

The main change is to try to cut back some of the future looking behaviour that was written back when this was created. The story is now stable:

  • Permissions aggregate the permission to use an api from permissions policy, secure context, user prompt, or whatever else accesses it.
  • You can query the current permission.
  • That's it - revoking the permission is not supported in the API, and neither is requesting it.

I also added a security considerations section for the Geolocation overview page. Next iteration of these docs I'd hope to perhaps do this for all the permission using APIs. From that I could add a list of things that cause the permission prompt to this doc.

Related docs work can be tracked in #35765
items.title: Permission API updates
